title: Wonder Dog Comes Out on Top at the Supreme Court (Audio)
itunes:title: Wonder Dog Comes Out on Top at the Supreme Court (Audio)
description:
(Bloomberg) -- Robert Dinerstein, director of the clinical program, associate dean for experiential education, and director of the Disability Rights Law Clinic at American University's Washington College of Law, discusses the Supreme Court case Fry v Napoleon, in which the justices ruled in favor of a disabled girl who was prevented from bringing her service dog, Wonder, to school with her. He speaks with June Grasso and Michael Best on Bloomberg Radio's "Bloomberg Law."

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
